page.title: 05OXSHOTT HEATH
page.content: Oxhott Heath is a large public open space. It consists of various trees especially Scots pines and oaks with other ground cover plants. There is a sandy pit which is slightly marshy at the bottom. People exercise their dogs there and go for family walks. On the top of a hill, there is a{war {memorial}to the local people who died in the First and Second World Wars. There are also benches as memorials for people with a plaque with their name engraved on it. Lower down the hill there is heather growing, parts being fenced off so that where it has died it can regrow without being walked on.
